item.title: Galton board simulation in Python
item.description: Sketch of the ideas: Consider each sampling of the balls as a 1-dimensional random walk, which takes only two possible directions: left or right, at each step. The directional path (i.e., we don’t consider its length but only direction) of the ball is then equivalent to a sequence of L/R (or -1/1, or 0/1, whatever you like) of length $n$, where $n$ is the number of rows of the Galton board (the size of the map).
